intro: Sisymbrium heteromallum var. sinense, commonly known as Chinese wild radish, is an annual herbaceous plant native to East Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and alternate, pinnately lobed leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers in racemes, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its fruits are cylindrical pods that split open to release seeds, a characteristic typical of the Brassicaceae family. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in fields, roadsides, and waste areas.
